channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [OAK-5651] java.lang.IllegalStateException logged when migrating Segment to Document
item.description:
After migrating the SegmentMK to DocumentMK following exception is logged:

12:38:58.816 INFO  [main] RepositorySidegrade.java:310      Copying checkpoints is not supported for this combination of node stores
12:38:58.835 ERROR [main] BackgroundObserver.java:176       Uncaught exception in org.apache.jackrabbit.oak.plugins.document.bundlor.BundlingConfigHandler@3c782d8e

12:38:58.836 INFO  [main] DocumentNodeStore.java:663        Starting disposal of DocumentNodeStore with clusterNodeId: 1 (id: 1, startTime: 1487072336420, machineId: mac:38c98646844e, instanceId: /Users/rekawek/granite/jackrabbit-oak/oak-upgrade, pid: 76780, uuid: 4089c6f3-c563-4734-8816-4ee7fb712ce5, readWriteMode: null, state: NONE, revLock: NONE, oakVersion: 1.8-SNAPSHOT)

It can be reproduced with the oak-upgrade test:

mvn -f oak-upgrade/pom.xml clean test -Dtest=SegmentToMongoTest && cat oak-upgrade/target/unit-tests.log
item.summary: java.lang.IllegalStateException logged when migrating Segment to Document

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
The exception started to show up after r1765640 commit, which is a part of the OAK-1312.

chetanm, could you comment if this is something to worry about? Or maybe the oak-upgrade take some extra steps when disposing the DocumentMK?

tomek.rekawek That change introduced a Observer which is now registered by default with DocumentNodeStore and that observer does a diff which causes the exception. So this exception can come if any observer is registered/active when such a migration is happening.

Probably we should disable the observation support in DocumentNodeStore when sidegrade is running is we need to prevent such diff for large commit

mreutegg Thoughts?

chetanm, if we disable the observation support on the destination DocumentMK repository, won't this break something? In particular, won't it break the bundling support? If so, maybe we can disable the bundling support for the time of migration? Right now, it seems it's the only feature that logs such exceptions.

if we disable the observation support on the destination DocumentMK repository, won't this break something?

The BundlingConfigHandler just does a simple diff and I believe any other observer would also be doing that and would thus break. So unless we make that work we can disable the observation support.

If so, maybe we can disable the bundling support for the time of migration?

I would like to have bundling enabled for migration. If disabling observation support comepletely is not possible we can modify the bundling logic to disable observer part but still have bundling enabled

we can modify the bundling logic to disable observer part but still have bundling enabled

Done. Could you review the attached patch?
Fixed for trunk in r1783075.
Backported to 1.6 in r1783192.

The current fix avoids the exception but does not address the real issue. AFAICS the root cause is a malformed journal entry with an empty String for the branch commits. Usually this does not happen, but those upgrade tests run with DocumentMK.disableBranches().
Added an ignored test to oak-core in trunk: http://svn.apache.org/r1783731
And an additional simpler test in JournalEntryTest: http://svn.apache.org/r1783733
Attached proposed fix OAK-5651-1.patch.

Applied patch to trunk: http://svn.apache.org/r1783742

chetanm, tomek.rekawek can you please review before I merge it into the 1.6 branch?
LGTM. Also, the original exception attached in description disappeared (even after reverting my workaround fix).
Thanks for the reviews. I merged the changes into the 1.6 branch: http://svn.apache.org/r1783763
Backported to 1.4 in r1792732.
